snippet: The recent Metro-North Railroad crash cast renewed attention on the mix of trains, cars and humans that make crossings in the region among the most dangerous in the country.
abstract: Fatal Metro-North Railroad crash in Valhalla, NY, has cast renewed scrutiny on dangers posed by railroad crossings across country, and in the New York metropolitan area in particular; New York Times investigation focuses on 10 of the most statistically dangerous crossings in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut according to metric devised by the Federal Railroad Admin.

byline.original: By RUSS BUETTNER and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS
byline.contributor: Jason Grant and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The recent Metro-North Railroad crash cast renewed attention on the mix of trains, cars and humans that make crossings in the region among the most dangerous in the country.

headline.main: In New York Area, Points Where Train and Tragedy Are Likely to Intersect
headline.print_headline: Where Trains and Tragedy Often Intersect
